But the stock, which closed $62.33 on Friday, is still about 20 per cent below its record peak set in mid-2016. Retailers have been heralding the coronavirus crisis as a permanent shift towards online retailing in the Australian market and a sharp reduction in the amount of real estate taken up by bricks and mortar sellers. And Meij believes fast food sellers and quick-service restaurants (QSRs) will not be exempt from this shift, with home delivery and digital likely to be become the norm. Many companies were poorly managed; many had terrible business models that were beginning ... shove. ADVERTISEMENT The result is a transformed American economy.
